body_html:
yes, there will be many ifdef to disable double sycl kernels (within the scope of TENSORFLOW_USE_SYCL).

It is a runtime error. At build time, sycl device compiler (/usr/local/computecpp/bin/compute++) compiles the sycl kernels into SPIR. While at runtime, the SPIR (including double operations) is passed to OpenCL implementation. There will be an issue if the OpenCL implementation does not support double, which is allowed by OpenCL spec.

While at runtime, the SPIR (including double operations) is passed to OpenCL implementation. There will be an issue if the OpenCL implementation does not support double, which is allowed by OpenCL spec.
body:
yes, there will be many ifdef to disable double sycl kernels (within the scope of TENSORFLOW_USE_SYCL).

It is a runtime error.  At build time, sycl device compiler (/usr/local/computecpp/bin/compute++) compiles the sycl kernels into SPIR. While at runtime, the SPIR (including double operations) is passed to OpenCL implementation. There will be an issue if the OpenCL implementation does not support double, which is allowed by OpenCL spec.
